name: suable
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
If a person or an organization is suable, it is possible to sue them (= to take legal action against them): A judge ruled that the two companies were separate entities, and thus the mine owner was not technically suable. Making defamatory remarks in public could be sueable.
If an offence is suable, it is possible to sue (= take legal action against ) the person or organization that has committed it: It's not a suable offence to complain online about a company being unhelpful.
